runs.comm: on the pads, Warner clips it away through leg
Watson cuts this one away behind point, he's off the mark too
on the pads, Watson turns the ball to midwicket
and there's the first boundary of the innings, Warner gets a half-volley on his pads and drives through midwicket
pulled in the air, on the bounce to the man running around from deep square leg
Watson defends this time
tossed up well outside off, Warner leaves it alone
straighter line, Warner backs off and works it to point
around the wicket to Watson, who defends
angled in to leg, Watson drives to long-on
well played by Warner, who punches off the back foot through the gap at cover and away to the boundary, nice placement
quicker and flatter, Warner can't beat cover
Watson guides this off the face of the bat and away to third man
another boundary as Warner flashes outside off, one hand off the bat, and the ball sails over point
wide of off, Warner has room to free himself and slash through the gap forward of point
width again outside off, and too much on this occasion, it's called wide
straighter line from Taylor, and Warner on the back foot pushes to mid-off
that is a massive six! Really big one from Warner, who gets a half-volley and simply launches a baseball-style slog straight back over the bowler's head and it lands on the roof of the pavilion
Warner is gone, Gayle takes a sharp catch at slip. Again Taylor gave Warner a little width, but this time not quite as much, and Warner threw everything at it only to get an edge to Gayle

well now, both openers have departed. Benn around the wicket to Watson and fired it down leg, Watson has gone for the sweep only to have the ball run off the bottom of his gloves and back onto the stumps
Haddin is forward to defend
Haddin defends again
angled in and not much spin, Haddin defends
straight bat once again, Haddin is happy to have a look for now
another watchful stroke, defended to leg
aiming at the stumps, Clarke defends
watchful in defence again
Clarke uses his feet nicely, drifting in to his pads and he skips forward to clip through midwicket
fired down leg again, Clarke gets some pad on that and can't get a single
this time they do take a very quick single, just nudging to leg
Haddin looks to glance behind square but fine leg is up and he can't get off the mark
tossed up and some turn for Benn, Clarke gets it away edgily
again Clarke advances, and drives to long-on
Haddin is off the mark, on the back foot driving to mid-on
uses his feet and defends
clipped through midwicket for a single
driven back at the bowler Benn, who does his own fielding
drifting in to Clarke, who defends
turned away through square leg for an easy single
way down leg side there, Haddin sweeps and gets it fine but short fine leg Chanderpaul dives across to make a good save and knock the ball down
driven back to the bowler
tossed up on leg stump, Clarke drives to long-on

quick work from Ramdin to take the bails off, and the third umpire is required. Miller from over the wicket turned the ball from outside leg past the edge of Haddin, who has backed way, but the batsman's foot was down, he's safe
Clarke closes the face and works a single through square leg
Haddin goes over the top for the first time, Bravo gives him one on a good length outside off, Haddin lifts it over mid-on
this time Haddin opens the face and runs it away to third man, that's sharp running for Clarke and Haddin to get back for two
angled in to the stumps short of a length, Haddin defends
lovely placement, Haddin gives himself a little room and cuts off the back foot forward of point for a boundary
Haddin doesn't beat cover on this occasion
on the pads, clipped to midwicket for a single
short and on the pads, Haddin tries for a vicious pull but doesn't connect
pushed away to cover
tossed up and Clarke advances, he drives back towards the bowler
worked off his pads for one to backward square leg
well down leg once again, Haddin just helps it on its way to fine leg
on the pads, it's clipped through square leg
Haddin gets down on one knee and looks for an aerial sweep, can't make contact
backs away and pushes to off
on the back foot and worked to midwicket
drifts down leg from over the wicket, again it's simply helped on its way to fine leg
worked away to leg once more
not middled at all by Haddin, but he gets enough on it to find the boundary. It was on off stump, he looked for the drive over mid-off and the gap allowed it to trickle in to the boundary
better shot this time, shorter ball and Haddin pulls through square leg with power
defended back to the bowler
swept away to fine leg
angled across Clarke, who pushes to point and wants the single, but can't get one
driven to long-on, really good running to get back for two there
turned off the pads to square leg
Clarke advances and drives to mid on
uses his feet once more, driven to long-off
leg-side line, it's clipped through square leg
pushed away through cover for a single
punched down the ground off the back foot
Haddin advances and looks to pull, but a thickish bottom edge is all he can manage
pulled to midwicket and they get a very sharp single
taken from well outside off by Clarke, who slaps the ball along the ground to long-on

oh, wonderful piece of fielding from Bravo! Haddin guided it off the face to short third man where Bravo dived to his right to make the stop, then fired the ball into the stumps to have Clarke short trying for the single. Great save and super throw, and perhaps a little bit of lazy running from Clarke, who didn't seem to be extending his bat properly
driven to cover, can't beat the infield
Hussey is on the back foot and drives through cover
yorker on the legs, Hussey clips it to fine leg
angled in towards the stumps, driven to mid-off for a quick single
Taylor dragged that one down, too short and wide, Haddin waited on it nicely to cut the ball over gully and safely away to the boundary
clipped through leg for a couple out to deep midwicket
short ball and Haddin swivels a pull to fine leg
slower ball, Hussey pushes to point
dragged down and Haddin crunches straight to short cover
cut behind point, there's a single available there
drifting in from outside off, it's pushed to cover
drifts in to the pads, tries for a big slog over midwicket but can't connect
leans forward to defend
Haddin backs away and on the back foot, cuts through cover for a single to the man on the boundary
fullish ball on off stump, it's driven to long-on

that's a brave and powerful shot, Taylor swings it in towards off stump and Hussey backs off and lifts the ball over extra cover, once bounce over the boundary. Had he missed that, he would certainly have been bowled
driven down the ground for a single
cut to point, can't beat the field
driven down the ground for another single to long-on
well, how that has reached the boundary is a mystery. It was a shortish ball that Hussey back away from, and somehow it's dipped on Ramdin and bounced under his gloves and away to the boundary
short ball, this time Hussey ducks and Ramdin takes it
punched back to the bowler
ah, Haddin won't be there to hit the winning runs, he's tried to force this one over the top and has only managed to get it to mid-on, where Sammy takes a straightforward chance
game over. That is an odd way to finish, Chris Gayle has bowled a quicker bouncer, deliberately, and the ball has sailed over White and Ramdin and away to the boundary
